intro: Chamaesyce celastroides var. kaenana, commonly known as the Kaena sandmat, is a low-growing, mat-forming plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its prostrate growth habit and small, ovate leaves. The plant thrives in coastal and sandy environments, often found on wind-swept shores and dunes. Its flowers are unisexual, with male and female flowers occurring on separate plants, and it produces small, capsule-like fruits. This species is adapted to harsh, arid conditions and plays a role in stabilizing coastal soils.
